Please welcome Janetta Blair to FHUSD. She is very excited to work with the Special Education team at FHMS as an ELA resource teacher.

Janetta graduated from GCU with a Bachelor of Science in Educational studies, and is currently working on her Masters in Special Education, also at GCU. She has worked in Education upwards of 16 years. Being a big theatre buff, Janetta has incorporated her talents into working with middle-schoolers in a 21st Century after school drama program. She has also coached middle school cheer, and helped to start up a morning coffee cart with a high school special education class. Her heart is always with the kids she works with!

Janetta and her husband relocated back to Arizona from Colorado, and chose Fountain Hills as their home. They have a big family of seven kids with their youngest daughter recently graduating from high school. Golf is a big deal with this family, and now have two golf pros to brag about.

Janetta is extremely grateful to be a part of the FHUSD family!

Welcome Janetta to our team!

Denise Rose is excited to join the team at McDowell Mountain Elementary School as a special education teacher for the 2020-2021 school year.

Ms Rose is 44 years old and was born and raised in Scottsdale, Arizona. She has a sister who was born with Hydrophilic (water on the brain), which influenced her to go into special education due to her sister's struggles growing up. Denise got her degree from Arizona State University (ASU) in 2003 with a degree in Interdisciplinary Studies. She received her masters in December 2015 from ASU with a degree in Special Education Cross Categorical and an Elementary Education certification. Ms Rose has taught students with autism for the past 10 years and co taught a 7th grade math class for a year.

Denise also has a pug named Olive that is a year old. In her spare time she enjoys spending time with her family and taking daily trips around Arizona.

Welcome Denise!

Every year, FHUSD participates in the Scripps National Spelling Besystem including 3rd-8th grade students from MMES and FHMS. The first step is the written test that all third graders took before winter break and resulted in 24 students participating in the bee on January 8.
Everyone did a marvelous job including the top four students who will compete in the district bee in the evening on Thursday, January 30 at 6:00 p.m. at the District Learning Center with 21 other winning students from FHMS:
MMES Spelling Bee Champion: Levi Lara
2nd Place: Angelo Latko
3rd Place: Ben Goodman
4th Place: DeMya Staten
In addition to the certificates that all participants received, MMES champion, Levi Lara was presented with a medal, a one-year subscription to Encyclopedia Britannica Kids Online, and a Kindle Fire donated by the Peter and Theresa Conti Foundation
Finally, the 1st place champion of the district bee will compete in the regional spelling bee in Deer Valley on February 20 involving winners from grades up to 8th grade from Deer Valley, Cave Creek, Paradise Valley, and Scottsdale.

Please welcome Jeff Gauer, Ph.D., who starts this fall as a 7th grade English teacher at Fountain Hills Middle School. Jeff comes to FHMS after a 30-year career spanning the military, international business management, and university education. From 1984-1996, Jeff served as a US Army military intelligence officer (Russian counter intelligence). As a business manager, Jeff has worked throughout the US and in 27 countries, and was the regional manager for Bobcat machinery in the 15 countries of the former Soviet Union. Dr. Gauer holds degrees in English (BA), business (MBA) and organization and management (Ph.D.). As an educator, Jeff has taught at The University of Michigan Graduate School of Management and at Gallaudet University for the Deaf in Washington, DC. Dr. Gauer is a published author (7 books and 3 academic articles) and he looks forward to sharing his motivation, skills and experience with his FHMS students. Jeff resides in Scottsdale with his son, Graham, who studies forestry at Paradise Valley Community College Black Mountain.
